name: James W. Riley Jr.
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: Since 1972, Jim Riley has concentrated his practice on litigation. As lead or local counsel, he represents manufacturers, insurers, financial institutions, and other businesses in litigation in state and federal trial, and appellate courts. Cases handled include contract and insurance coverage disputes, products liability cases, trademark and patent infringement actions, and professional liability claims. He has tried more than 20 cases to jury verdicts. He has served on the Local Rules Advisory Committee of the United States District Court for the Southern District of Indiana since 2000.

Jim is also an experienced neutral. As a member of the American Arbitration Association panel of commercial arbitrators since 2006, he is also on the AAA Large and Complex Commercial Case Panel. He is on the AAA Mediation and Consumer Mediation Panels. Additionally, Jim is on the Indiana Panel for National Arbitration and Mediation. He has handled a variety of cases including disputes involving: contracts for supply of goods and services, employment, indemnity; insurance coverage; crop insurance claims; automobile dealer franchises; credit card accounts; and first party insurance claims. He also served as a mediator in the Indianapolis Bar Association’s innovative Settlement Week Program and continues to serve as a mediator in commercial and business cases. He was the Medical Review Panel Chair in more than 150 medical malpractice cases.

items: Defended owner from claims in excess of 70 million dollars relating to construction accident property damage and prosecuted related insurance coverage action.
Represented manufacturers in catastrophic injury products liability actions to defense verdicts.
Represented manufacturer in multiple fatality wrongful death products liability action to defense verdict.
Represented telecommunication company in trademark and patent infringement actions.
Represented generic drug manufacturers in ANDA patent infringement actions.
Represented bank in Directors and Officers liability and insurance coverage actions.
Represented retailer in commercial action against banks.

name: Katie R. Osborne
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: Katie Osborne concentrates her practice in civil litigation. She defends health care providers, including hospitals, physicians, nurses, and long-term care facilities against medical negligence claims and 42 U.S.C. § 1983 claims. Katie has extensive experience defending qualified health care providers, both before the Indiana Department of Insurance and in Indiana State Courts. In 2024, she and co-counsel secured a defense verdict in favor of their health care provider client following a 9-day jury trial. Katie also skillfully defends health care providers in federal court, securing dismissal and summary judgment where possible. She competently supports her clients through all phases of litigation, from pre-suit investigation through appeal.

bio.heading: Other practice areas:
content: Additionally, Katie represents businesses in various matters including premises liability claims, contract disputes, and employment-related issues. She defends employers against claims involving restrictive covenants, discrimination, and wrongful termination. Katie engages in client-focused representation and uses a hands-on approach to managing actions with complex factual and legal issues.

items: Obtained a defense verdict following a nine-day medical malpractice trial where the patient claimed that negligence in the recommendation for and performance of robotic radical hysterectomy for stage 1BI cervical cancer resulted in bilateral ureteral injury.

Defended more than one hundred health care providers against medical malpractice claims before the Indiana Department of Insurance. Successfully obtained favorable medical review panel opinions which have led to the dismissal or abandonment of state court action.
Secured dismissal for plaintiff’s failure to comply with the timeliness provisions of the Medical Malpractice Act.

Respectfully advised and guided dozens of individually named health care providers through all phases of threatened or pending litigation, including depositions, mediation, and settlement, and provided guidance for completing credentialing applications.
Obtained summary judgment on behalf of health care providers who have obtained favorable opinions from medical review panels.
Represented dozens of health care provider clients in defense of premises liability claims involving slip and falls by visitors in/around facility.
Represented manufacturing company on breach of contract action for negligent construction of facility. Case settled favorably to client.
Represented business client in dispute against software development company for failure to timely deliver product pursuant to agreed specifications/timeline. Caused settled favorably to client.
Represented business client in defense of a claim brought by former employee/member.
Represented employer before Indiana Civil Rights Commission and secured a favorable determination from the Commission.
Defended employer in enforcing restrictive covenants and confidentiality provisions of employment agreement, resulting in favorable settlement.

Defended employer against age discrimination claim where employee was terminated for failing to report an accident which resulted in damage to a customer’s property. Case settled favorably for client prior to trial.
Defended employer against race discrimination claim where employee was terminated for violation of attendance policy. Case settled favorably for client.
Filed motion for summary judgement on plaintiff’s discrimination and wrongful termination claims, after which plaintiff’s counsel withdrew and the action was dismissed for failure to prosecute.

bio.heading: Biography
content: Donald Smith limits his practice to representing employers and executives in labor and employment matters. He defends employers in cases pending before state and federal courts, the National Labor Relations Board, Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, Indiana Civil Rights Commission, U.S. Department of Labor, OSHA, IOSHA, Indiana Department of Workforce Development, and Indiana Worker’s Compensation Board.

Don advises employers concerning various employment issues such as employee handbooks, employment agreements, severance agreements, covenants not to compete, restrictive covenants, wrongful termination, collective bargaining, labor arbitration, unions, discrimination, harassment, wage and hour matters, unemployment compensation, and worker’s compensation.

bio.heading: Representative Matters
content: Since he started practicing law more than 40 years ago, Don has limited his practice to labor and employment law. Don has extensive experience representing clients in the following industries: Credit unions, construction, insurance, manufacturing, retail, health care, printing, temporary labor, restaurant, and housing.

items: Prosecuted and defended numerous requests for temporary and permanent injunctions in non-compete cases on behalf of employers.

Defended an insurance company in employment discrimination case that set the standard for determining whether an insurance agent is an independent contractor: Knight v. United Farm Bureau Mut. Ins. Co., Inc., 950 F.2d 377 (7th Cir. 1991).
Defended county employer at trial and on appeal against wrongful discharge claim: Moulton v. Vigo Co., 150 F.3d 801 (7th Cir. 1998).

Represented employer in a religious discrimination case, in which employee unsuccessfully sought court intervention permitting employee to use the phrase “Have a blessed day” in the workplace: Anderson v. U.S.F. Logistics, 274 F.3d. 470 (7th Cir. 2001).

Represented employer in a wage case, in which the Indiana Court of Appeals reversed the trial court’s award of vacation pay to the employee, and enforced the employer’s written policy that vacation pay was not earned until the employee’s anniversary date: Damon Corp. v. Estes, 750 N.E.2d 891 (Ind. Ct. App. 2001).

Represented employer hospital in a worker’s compensation case, in which the Indiana Supreme Court ruled that the Worker’s Compensation Board lacked the statutory authority to award interest on worker’s compensation benefits, including overdue medical bills: Christopher R. Brown, DDS, Inc. v. Decatur Co. Memorial Hospital, Inc., 892 N.E.2d 642 (Ind. 2008).
Defended employer in a class action in a wage and hour case: Artis v. First Revenue Assurance, LLC, (1:09-cv-01555, S. D. Ind. 2009).

name: Eric M. Hylton
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: Eric Hylton’s practice primarily involves representing employers and employees in labor and employment matters. His primary focus is on labor and employment issues affecting teachers throughout the State of Indiana. In addition, he represents both employers and employees in cases pending before State and Federal Courts, the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) and the Indiana Civil Rights Commission. Eric also advises employers and employees concerning various employment issues such as employee handbooks, employment agreements, covenants not to compete, wrongful termination, collective bargaining, labor arbitration, discrimination, harassment, wage and hour matters, unemployment compensation, and workers compensation.

name: Jaclyn M. Flint
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: Jaclyn represents and advises clients in a wide variety of business and litigation matters, including matters related to commercial and business litigation, sports, entertainment, media, intellectual property, licensing, and corporate formation.

Prior to joining Riley Bennett Egloff LLP, Jaclyn served as a federal Law Clerk for the United States District Court for the Southern District of Indiana, where she had the honor of working with the Honorable Judges Larry J. McKinney, Sarah Evans Barker, and Tanya Walton Pratt. Through this experience, Jaclyn gained unique litigation experience and insight into the judicial process.

bio.heading: Intellectual Property, Sports & Entertainment Law
content: Jaclyn is well respected for her intellectual property practice, in which she provides legal counsel on trademark, copyright, right of publicity, trade dress, and trade secret matters, including registration and prosecution, licensing, and litigation. As part of her sports and entertainment and intellectual property practice, Jaclyn, an avid sports fan, has done substantial work in the emerging area of name, image, and likeness (NIL) in collegiate athletics.

Jaclyn provides pro-bono legal counsel to the Boilermaker Alliance (a non-profit NIL collective for Purdue University student athletes) and serves as legal counsel to multiple businesses in their efforts to engage collegiate athletes in promotional and marketing activities. She also assisted in the development of terms of use for the development of software technology serving as a portal for collegiate athletes to engage in NIL opportunities. Prior to joining RBE, Jaclyn worked as a legal extern for the NCAA Enforcement Department and for the former Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) Athletics Department.

bio.heading: Indiana State Bar Association & IndyBar
content: A graduate of the ISBA Leadership Development Academy Class 11, Jaclyn is committed to several professional organizations at board and committee level roles in the Indianapolis area. She serves on the executive committees for the Indianapolis Bar Association’s Intellectual Property section as Chair-Elect and as a former Chair for the Sports and Entertainment section.

Jaclyn has also worked extensively on the development, revitalization, and growth of The Racing Attorneys Conference (TRAC), a traveling conference to promote the education and camaraderie of attorneys in the motor sports industry from across the United States.

bio.heading: Education
content: Jaclyn attended the Indiana University Robert H. McKinney School of Law, where she graduated summa cum laude and served as an Executive Articles Editor for the Indiana Law Review. Jaclyn also acted as the President of the Indiana University McKinney Sports and Entertainment Law Society as a Dean’s Tutorial Society Fellow, providing guidance and tutoring services to first-year law students. During her time in law school, Jaclyn also worked as a research assistant to multiple professors, including those with a focus on intellectual property matters.

name: Katie S. Riles
title: Indiana’s New Business Fraud Prevention Law

bio.heading: Overview
content: Assistant: Rebecca D. Keever

bio.heading: Business Law
content: Katie advises on business formation, guiding clients in entity selection and structuring. She drafts and negotiates key governance documents, including operating agreements, bylaws, and shareholder agreements. As outside general counsel, she supports businesses with ownership transitions, employment agreements, and business succession planning.

With significant expertise in mergers and acquisitions, Katie represents buyers and sellers through all stages of the transaction, from letters of intent and due diligence to negotiating purchase agreements and providing post-closing support. She also drafts and negotiates various business contracts, including distribution, subcontractor, and SaaS agreements.

Katie’s experience extends to loan documentation, assisting both financial institutions and businesses with loan structuring, as well as preparing and filing mortgages and financing statements. She also supports clients raising capital through exempt offerings, including private placement memoranda and Form D filings.

bio.heading: Real Estate Law
content: Katie regularly assists with commercial and residential real estate transactions, including drafting purchase agreements, conducting due diligence, and reviewing title documents. She also works with landlords and tenants on lease negotiations and drafting for commercial and industrial properties.

bio.heading: Probate Matters
content: Katie helps individuals and families with estate administration matters, guiding personal representatives through the probate process.
Katie’s holistic approach to legal services blends deep knowledge with a focus on client-specific solutions, ensuring effective outcomes and long-term client success.

name: Anthony R. Jost
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: Tony Jost represents clients in various aspects of business, and civil litigation, including commercial, real estate, employment, and complex tort litigation in both federal and state court.

He counsels clients in commercial lease drafting, negotiation and enforcement, and real estate and business acquisition and financing. Tony further advises clients as to proper selection and formation of business entities, lender documentation, franchising, state and federal business regulatory matters, and general contractual matters.

Tony represents creditors in all formal bankruptcy proceedings in federal court, provides workout answers and advice on behalf of creditors, prosecutes collection claims, and defends creditors in various aspects, including but not limited to fraudulent conveyance and preference claims.

He provides answers, advice and advocacy in all aspects of business, commercial and litigation affairs with specific emphasis on the finance, health care, governmental, construction, transportation, and telecommunications sectors.
Tony also served on the Firm’s Management Committee from 2013 to 2018.

items: Represented multiple multi-billion dollar creditors in all aspects of bankruptcy proceedings.
Defended at trial a number of lawsuits against trucking companies for claims involving personal injury and property damage.
Prosecuted large mechanics lien and breach of construction contract claims on behalf of general contractors, seeking payment for construction products and services.
Prosecuted claims on behalf of health-care providers in pursuing payment under service provider agreements and other contracts.
Represented banking clients in preparing and negotiating loan documents and service agreements and in prosecuting claims associated with breaches under those documents and agreements.
Negotiated and drafted finance, transactional and organizational documents for various clients.
Successfully defended and tried lawsuits in commercial, real estate, employment and complex litigation matters on numerous occasions.

name: Lindsay A. Llewellyn
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: With a mind wired for inquiry and analysis, Lindsay Llewellyn thrives in the dynamic, high-stakes world of litigation. Her natural inclination to ask the right questions, dig into the details, and unravel complex problems makes her a formidable advocate and a trusted strategist.

For Lindsay, litigation is the ultimate intellectual challenge; a real-world puzzle where preparation, insight, and precision make all the difference. Whether crafting persuasive arguments or navigating fast-moving disputes, she brings sharp analytical thinking, resilience, and genuine passion to every case she handles.

In her civil litigation practice, Lindsay advocates for clients in both state and federal courts throughout Indiana, bringing a strategic and solutions-focused approach to every case. She has represented a wide range of clients – including businesses, individuals, insurers, health care providers, and government entities – across a spectrum of complex disputes.

Her experience spans contract and commercial litigation, insurance coverage issues, real estate and property claims, premises liability, and employment-related matters. Lindsay has also litigated appeals before both the Indiana Court of Appeals and the Seventh Circuit Court of Appeals.

bio.heading: Law Clerk Experience
content: Prior to joining Riley Bennett Egloff, Lindsay worked for the United States District Court for the Southern District of Indiana, where she served as the inaugural law clerk to Magistrate Judge Doris L. Pryor for nearly five years, and later as law clerk to Magistrate Judge M. Kendra Klump. As a law clerk, Lindsay assisted in research and drafting orders in a variety of civil matters. While in law school, Lindsay was a judicial extern for the Honorable Heather Welch and the Honorable Timothy Oakes of the Marion County Superior Courts.

bio.heading: Community Engagement
content: As a graduate of the Indiana State Bar Association’s (ISBA) Leadership Development Academy Class 11, Lindsay is committed to serving her personal and professional community. She serves on the Executive Committee for the Women & the Law Division of the Indianapolis Bar Association and regularly volunteers with the Indianapolis Bar Association, providing bar exam takers with essay assistance.
Represented eight individuals who suffered property damage due to a roofing company’s activities. Obtained favorable settlements for all individuals, including attorney fees.
Represented a business owner whose information had been used in an internet scam. Obtained verdict in favor of client.
Represented health care provider clients in defense of premises liability claims involving slip and falls by visitors in/around facility.
Represented health care providers in defense of Section 1983 claims.
Represented a business owner in defense of an invalid mechanic’s lien.

name: Sarah MacGill Marr
title: Biography

bio.heading: Overview
content: Assistant: Penny A. Curtis

bio.heading: Biography
content: Sarah is a trial attorney who represents local, regional, and national companies in commercial litigation in both state and federal courts around the country. She practices in the areas of products liability, construction, transportation, and complex commercial litigation. She represents clients in all stages of the litigation process, including trial, and has successfully defended claims for breach of contract, tortious interference with contractual and business relationships, alleged product defects, and premises liability.

Sarah has extensive experience with discovery of electronically-stored information (ESI), and regularly advises clients on document retention and storage matters, as well as leading ESI efforts in litigation. Additionally, Sarah counsels clients regarding best practices to avoid litigation, including tips for negotiating and drafting their contracts.

Sarah’s undergraduate degree is from Indiana University Bloomington and she earned her JD is from the Indiana University Robert H. McKinney School of Law. She is admitted to practice law in the State of Indiana, the District of Columbia, and before the U.S. District Court for the Northern and Southern Districts of Indiana, and the U.S. Court of Appeals for the 7th Circuit.

Sarah is a life-long resident of Indiana and has been with the firm since she graduated from law school. She is dedicated to making Indianapolis a thriving community, and has been involved in local and state-wide political organizations which are committed to the causes that seek to enhance the community.
In 2024, Sarah was elected to the Firm’s Management Committee.

bio.heading: Representative Matters
content: Construction Litigation

items: Successfully defended multi-million dollar property damage claims brought by a municipal entity against our client for negligence and breach of contract as well as cross-claims brought by other parties against our client. Case was favorably resolved prior to trial.

Defended general contractor at bench trial where allegations included claims that the contractor had extensively damaged property off the project site. Obtained favorable result on behalf of our client.
Defended engineering firm in matter involving multiple fatalities where the allegations included negligence and breach of other professional duties. Matter was resolved prior to trial.
Defended subcontractor in connection with large claims for negligence and breach of contract relating to construction of a large multi-family housing unit. Case settled favorably prior to trial.

content: Products Liability Litigation

items: Defended product manufacturer in litigation involving claims that a consumer appliance was defective where damages exceeded $1 million.

Defended product manufacturer in significant matter in Federal Court where allegations included claims for a defective appliance product and damages significantly exceeded expected values. Matter was favorably resolved prior to trial.

content: Commercial Litigation

items: Defended large corporate entity against allegations of breach of fiduciary duty, fraud, deception, and conversion brought by one shareholder of the corporate entity against the other shareholder and the entity itself. Prosecuted claims for fraud, conversion, breach of contract, and contribution against one of the shareholders. Case settled favorably prior to trial.

Defended national event promotor in the motorsports industry wherein a team asserted claims against another team, a sponsor, as well as our client. Secured Summary Judgment in favor of our client on all pending claims against it.

Represented corporate entity in a case where the minority shareholder asserted claims against the majority shareholder and ultimately sought a court-ordered buyout of the minority shares. Matter was favorably resolved prior to Court intervention.

content: Real Estate Litigation

items: Lead trial counsel in matter involving a dispute following the purchase of real estate in southern Indiana.
Defended General Contractor during proceedings involving damage to residential real estate.
Part of team representing a client in front of the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit.
Sarah regularly volunteers with the Southern District of Indiana Pro Bono Program.
Represented an incarcerated individual in connection with his claims asserted pursuant to the Eighth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States of America.
Represented an incarcerated individual in connection with his efforts to collect a judgment following the Court’s entry of Summary Judgment in his favor.

name: Megan S. Young
title: Biography

bio.heading: Overview
content: Assistant: Nikki Viau

bio.heading: Biography
content: Megan Young is an associate attorney at Riley Bennett Egloff with a practice focused on health care law, particularly the defense of hospitals and health care providers in medical malpractice claims.

An Indianapolis native, Megan earned her undergraduate degree in political science, with a minor in biology, from the University of Indianapolis, graduating summa cum laude. She was also a member of the university’s track and field team, competing as a pole vaulter.

Megan went on to earn her JD from Indiana University’s Robert H. McKinney School of Law, graduating cum laude and earning a Graduate Certificate in Health Law. During law school, she joined RBE as a summer associate, gaining valuable experience that deepened her interest in health care litigation and medical malpractice defense.

With a strong academic foundation in both political science and biology, and specialized training in health law, Megan brings a well-rounded and analytical perspective to complex medical-legal issues. Her background allows her to effectively understand and advocate for the unique needs of health care clients.

content: Health CareMedical Malpractice Defense

name: J.T. Wynne
title: Biography

bio.heading: Biography
content: J.T. is an Indianapolis native who has played tennis his entire life and has coached tennis since he was a freshman at North Central High School. J.T. attended Skidmore College where he was a member of the tennis team and earned his bachelors degree in Business and History.

J.T. returned to Indianapolis following his undergraduate studies to attend the Robert H. McKinney School of Law at Indiana University Indianapolis. He has been an assistant tennis coach at North Central for the last five years and hopes to continue to be involved in coaching the program as he begins his legal career. J.T. enjoys seeing the students grow as individuals both on and off the court.

In addition to coaching, J.T. enjoys watching and playing sports with friends. He is looking forward to beginning his career as an attorney focusing his practice on Corporate Law, Labor & Employment Law, and Real Estate Law.
